messages.content: What does Daenerys look like?
Daenerys has the classical Valyrian look; She has violet eyes, pale skin, and long, pale silver-gold hair.
How is Daenerys described in terms of her physique?
Daenerys is slender of frame, with small breasts.
Which languages can Daenerys speak?
Beside the Common Tongue, Daenerys speaks the bastard Valyrian of the Free Cities with a Tyroshi accent, and High Valyrian.
How was Daenerys treated by her brother Viserys?
Daenerys grew up terrified of and abused by her brother Viserys.
How do Daenerys' followers feel about her in 'A Song of Ice and Fire'?
Her followers generally regard her with great respect and love.
What does the house with the red door in Braavos symbolize for Daenerys?
The house with the red door in Braavos, where she lived until she was about five years old, has come to symbolize her lost childhood.
What is Daenerys' attitude towards ruling the Seven Kingdoms?
She believes that the Iron Throne is her by rights, as Viserys's heir, and that ruling the Seven Kingdoms is her duty.
What type of clothing does Daenerys wear when dressing in Dothraki garb?
Daenerys sometimes dresses in Dothraki garb; a painted vest and riding leathers, while going about barefoot, with her hair oiled and her skin sun-browned.
What personal items does Daenerys often wear as part of her attire?
She often wears silver bells in her braided hair per Dothraki custom, one for each of her victories.
Who are Daenerys Targaryen's parents?
Daenerys is the youngest child of King Aerys II Targaryen and his sister-wife, Queen Rhaella.
What significant event occurred during Daenerys' birth?
Daenerys was born nine months after their flight, while a great storm raged above Dragonstone, sinking what remained of the Targaryen fleet; for this reason she is known as 'Daenerys Stormborn'.
What happened to Daenerys' mother?
Her mother died in labor, but not before naming her.
What title did Daenerys receive as a result of her familial lineage?
Daenerys received the title 'Princess of Dragonstone' as Viserys's heir.
How did Daenerys and her brother Viserys end up in exile?
Ser Willem Darry and several other loyal retainers took the children from the nursery and smuggled them into exile, sailing to the Braavosian coast.
Where did Daenerys live in Braavos?
Viserys and Daenerys lived in Braavos in a house with a red door, where Daenerys had her own room, and a lemon tree underneath her window.
What were the circumstances around Daenerys leaving the house in Braavos?
After Willem's death, the servants he had hired stole all they could. The young Targaryens were put out of the house a while after.
How did Viserys's attitude change over the years?
Selling their mother's crown took the last of Viserys's joy, leaving only rage.
What belief did Daenerys grow up with regarding her marriage?
Because Viserys often told her that their line must be 'kept pure', Daenerys grew up believing that she would marry him once she came of age.
Where were Daenerys and Viserys before being taken in by Illyrio Mopatis?
In 297 AC, Viserys and Daenerys were taken in by Illyrio Mopatis, a magister of the Free City of Pentos, who offered his help in reclaiming the Iron Throne for Viserys.
What are House Targaryen's words?
House Targaryen's words are Fire and Blood.
What does the House Targaryen sigil represent?
Their sigil is a three-headed dragon breathing flames, red on black. The three-headed dragon represents Aegon the Conqueror and his two sisters, Rhaenys and Visenya.
What variation of the Targaryen sigil did Prince Aerion Targaryen use?
Prince Aerion Targaryen changed the colors of the three heads—one orange, one yellow, one red—while the flames they breathed had a sheen of gold leaf.
What type of armor did Prince Rhaegar Targaryen wear?
Prince Rhaegar Targaryen had the three-headed dragon wrought in rubies on his black breast plate.
What traditional seat is given to the heir-apparent of the Targaryen throne?

Their earlier seat of Dragonstone remained in their possession as well. It eventually became the traditional seat of the heir-apparent to the throne, who was known as the Prince of Dragonstone (or Princess of Dragonstone, in a few occasions).
What was the religious practice of House Targaryen before Aegon's Conquest?

House Targaryen historically followed the old gods of Valyria, but sometime before Aegon's Conquest the family abandoned the Valyrian gods and converted to the Faith of the Seven, the predominant religion in Westeros.
What is the Targaryen tradition for deceased family members?
Deceased Targaryens are traditionally cremated, a custom since the days of Old Valyria.
Where were the ashes of King Aegon I Targaryen interred?
The ashes of many of the dead of House Targaryen have been interred on Dragonstone, including those of King Aegon I.
What happened to the Targaryens during the Doom of Valyria?
The Targaryens were the only dragonriders of Valyria to survive.
How did House Targaryen handle the aftermath of the Doom of Valyria?
In the century that followed, four of the five dragons of House Targaryen died, with only Balerion surviving. Two more dragons, Vhagar and Meraxes, were hatched from eggs on Dragonstone.
Who succeeded Aegon III Targaryen and how old was the new king at the time?

When Aegon III Targaryen died in 157 AC from consumption, he was succeeded by his eldest son, Daeron I Targaryen, born to him by his second wife, Queen Daenaera Velaryon. Though Daeron was only fourteen years of age, his uncle, Prince Viserys, decided not to insist on a regency, and continued to serve his new king as Hand.
What was Daeron I's major military goal and what did he achieve?

Daeron I had great ambition, and wished to "complete the conquest" which his ancestor Aegon I Targaryen had begun a century and a half before. Daeron I managed to convince his councilors of his plans, and managed to conquer Dorne within a year.
What was the outcome of Daeron I's conquest of Dorne?

However, Daeron's conquest did not last. The smallfolk rebelled, and though Lord Tyrell attempted to fight back, traveling from holdfast to holdfast, the rebels always struck back. After he was murdered in his bed at Sandstone, all of Dorne rose in open rebellion, and they managed to liberate themselves within a fortnight.
How did King Baelor I approach peace with Dorne?

Though in King's Landing Prince Viserys argued for the execution of the Dornish hostages, the new King Baelor I decided to free them instead. He walked barefoot from King's Landing to Sunspear, escorting the hostages home, and met with the Prince of Dorne.
What significant actions did Baelor I take regarding his family?

When he finally returned to King's Landing, Baelor convinced the High Septon to dissolve his marriage to his sister, Daena, whom he had wed in 160 AC, as it had never been consummated. He then locked Daena and her sisters Rhaena and Elaena in the Maidenvault, to "preserve their innocence".
What led to the death of King Baelor I?
Baelor was found collapsed on the forty-first day, and died soon after, in 171 AC.
Who succeeded Viserys II Targaryen and what was rumored about his reign?
Viserys II was succeeded by his eldest son, Aegon IV, who was rumored to have had a hand in his father's death.
What action by Aegon IV sparked the Blackfyre Rebellion?

Aegon openly recognized his cousin Daena's son, Daemon Waters, as his own son and gifted him the Valyrian steel sword Blackfyre. Aegon's public gift of the sword to his bastard son was one of the seeds from which the First Blackfyre Rebellion would eventually grow.
How did the First Blackfyre Rebellion end?

The First Blackfyre Rebellion began in early 196 AC and lasted nigh on a year, ending late in the year with the Battle of the Redgrass Field. Daemon and his two eldest sons, Aegon and Aemon Blackfyre, were killed, whereas Aegor Rivers, another one of Daeron II's half-brothers, fled into exile with Daemon's remaining children and the sword Blackfyre.
What was the initial action Aegon V took at the start of his reign?

He felt forced to arrest Brynden Rivers, who had served both Maekar I and Aerys I as Hand, after Brynden, who had offered safe passage to Aenys Blackfyre, the fifth son of the late Daemon I Blackfyre, from Tyrosh to King's Landing, so Aenys could present his own claim during the Great Council, betrayed Aenys by arresting and executing him upon arrival.
How did Aegon V's reign continue after his initial actions?
Aegon spend much of his reign in battle. When winter ended in 236 AC, Daemon III Blackfyre and Aegor Rivers crossed the narrow sea to begin the Fourth Blackfyre Rebellion.
What were some of the domestic challenges Aegon V faced during his reign?

Further opposition came from the lords of Aegon V's realm, as many disagreed with his policies, or distrusted and hated him, as they felt that his wanderings with the hedge knight Duncan had left him "half a peasant".
What major family conflict arose during Aegon V's reign?

A major rebellion in 239 AC was caused by Aegon's eldest son. When Duncan, in 239 AC, broke his betrothal to a daughter of Lord Lyonel Baratheon to marry Jenny of Oldstones, going as far as to renounce his rights to the throne for her, Lord Lyonel declared the independence of the Stormlands in response.
What tragic event marked the end of Aegon V's reign?

Towards the end of his reign, Aegon V began to dream of dragons with whom he could bend the lords of Westeros to his will. However, in a great tragedy occurred, causing the death of Aegon V, Prince Duncan, and many more.
How did the War of the Ninepenny Kings begin?

Aegon V's second son Jaehaerys II Targaryen ascended the throne in 259 AC following the Tragedy of Summerhall, and was immediately faced with a threat from the east when the Band of Nine conquered first Tyrosh and then the Stepstones.
What led to the War of the Usurper, also known as Robert's Rebellion?
Aerys's acts triggered a chain of events that would become known as the War of the Usurper to Targaryen loyalists and Robert's Rebellion to those who fought on the rebel side.
How did the Targaryen dynasty end?
Following two hundred and eighty-three years of rule, the Targaryen dynasty ended in 283 AC with the death of Aerys II and the exile of his young son Viserys.
Who is claiming legitimacy as 'Viserys III'?
Across the narrow sea, the Aerys II Targaryen's surviving son is claiming legitimacy as 'Viserys III'.
What significant arrangement did Viserys make for his sister Daenerys?
With Illyrio's help, Viserys betroths his thirteen-year-old sister Daenerys to Drogo, a khal of the Dothraki, in exchange for the promise of warriors to reclaim his throne.
How does Daenerys's relationship with Viserys change during their time with the Dothraki?
During this time, Daenerys begins to learn to stand up to her brother, while Viserys's behavior leads to him being mocked by the other Dothraki.
What led to Viserys's death?
Viserys is killed by Drogo after threatening the lives of Daenerys and her unborn child with a sword, despite weapons being forbidden in the sacred city.
What vow does Drogo make after an assassination attempt on Daenerys?
After Daenerys escapes an assassination attempt by poison, Drogo vows to invade the Seven Kingdoms.
What complications arise from Drogo's battle injury?
When Drogo is injured in battle against another khalasar, Daenerys has one of her newly acquired slaves, Mirri Maz Duur, see to his wounds, but Drogo's wound infects nonetheless.
What tragic events occur due to Daenerys's decision to use blood magic?

Daenerys attempts to save his life by having Mirri perform blood magic, but this causes disagreement among the warriors in Drogo's khalasar, and ensues in fighting. Daenerys goes into labor and eventually wakes to find her child was stillborn and deformed, Drogo's khalasar broken up, and Drogo himself an empty shell of the man he once was.
What happens to Daenerys at the end of Drogo's funeral pyre?

She places her three dragon eggs on Drogo's funeral pyre, as well as Mirri. When the fire is burning, Daenerys enters the pyre herself, and when the flames have died out the next morning is found unharmed, with three newly-hatched dragons in her arms.
Who is Maester Aemon and what role does he play at Castle Black?

At the Wall in Westeros, the hundred-year-old Maester Aemon, brother to the late King Aegon V, still resides at Castle Black. Aemon intervenes when a new recruit, Jon Snow, asks for his help with a fellow recruit, Samwell Tarly, naming Sam his personal servant to prevent him from remaining in training, which would have meant his death.
What advice does Aemon give Jon regarding family and duty?

Aemon later advises Jon regarding the conflict of loyalty between family and duty to the Night's Watch, revealing he had felt such conflicting feelings himself trice, most recently when he was informed of the deaths of the last of his house.
What are the names of Daenerys's dragons?
Daenerys has named her three dragons Drogon, Rhaegal, and Viserion, after her late husband and brothers.
What occurs when Daenerys enters the House of the Undying?

She drinks shade-of-the-evening and enters the House of the Undying, where she meets the Undying Ones after seeing many visions. The Undying Ones give her cryptic information before attempting to consume her. Drogon rescues her, setting the House of the Undying on fire.
How does Daenerys acquire the Unsullied?
In Astapor, Daenerys acquires eight thousand six hundred Unsullied and five thousand boys in training.
How does Daenerys acquire the Unsullied?
In Astapor, Daenerys acquires eight thousand six hundred Unsullied and five thousand boys in training.
What decision does Daenerys make regarding Meereen?
Believing she needs to learn how to rule before conquering Westeros, Daenerys decides to remain in Meereen and rule as its queen.
How does Daenerys respond to the betrayal by Jorah Mormont?

Having discovered that Jorah Mormont had been spying on her for months for the Iron Throne and that his information had led to the poisoning attempt, Daenerys furiously gives them one chance to redeem themselves.
What action does Lord Commander Jon Snow take to protect Maester Aemon?

Lord Commander Jon Snow, fearing that the priestess Melisandre will wish to sacrifice Aemon to R'hllor for his king's blood, orders Aemon to travel to Oldtown, accompanied by Samwell Tarly, singer Dareon, wildling Gilly, and Mance Rayder's son.
What health issues does Aemon face during his journey to Oldtown?
Aemon's health deteriorates during the first part of the journey, and becomes worse once they are in Braavos.
What significant resistance does Daenerys face in Meereen?
A resistance group of Ghiscari noblemen, the Sons of the Harpy, engage in a shadow war against her, while Yunkai resumes its slavery and starts to make alliances against her.
What happens when Daenerys flies away on Drogon?

Daenerys is sickened by the battles, and after a female warrior is slain by a boar decides to leave. At the same time, Belwas falls ill due to eating poisoned locusts which had been meant for Daenerys. Just as Belwas falls to his feat, Drogon returns to the city and lands in the Pit. While the public panics and attempts to flee, Daenerys rushes to Drogon's side and flies away from Meereen on his back.
What is Quentyn Martell's mission in Meereen?

Doran Martell, Prince of Dorne, has sent his son Quentyn to Essos to find Daenerys. Having secretly made a wedding pact years before, promising the hand of his daughter Arianne in marriage to Viserys Targaryen in exchange for supporting Viserys's claim, Doran now wishes for Daenerys to fulfill the pact by marrying Quentyn.
What are Robert Baratheon's physical characteristics?
Robert has the classic Baratheon look: black hair and bright blue eyes.
How did Robert's appearance change after Greyjoy's Rebellion?
Due to excessive feasting and drinking, Robert gained a significant amount of weight. In the nine years since, he gained at least eight stone.
How is Robert perceived by his soldiers and people close to him?
Well loved by soldiers, Robert is brave, but headstrong, rash, and impatient.
What does Cersei Lannister think of Robert?
Cersei Lannister considers her husband to be an ignorant, dumb, slow-witted, drunken brute of a man, who does not have the ruthless streak she believes a king requires.
What are some of Robert's personal traits and preferences in battle?
Robert is as strong as a bull and fearless in battle. He loves the song of swords and considers poison to be a coward's weapon.
How does Robert handle defeated enemies?
As long as they are honest and brave, Robert can be merciful towards his defeated enemies, and he can inspire loyalty and friendship in those he spares.
What exception does Robert make regarding his enemies?
The only exception are the Targaryens; his hatred for them is a madness within him.
What weapon does Robert prefer in battle?
Robert fought with a spiked iron warhammer, crafted at Storm's End by Donal Noye.
Describe a piece of clothing often worn by Robert.
Robert owns a black velvet doublet decorated with a crowned golden stag.
What are some early life events of Robert Baratheon?
Born in 262 AC, Robert was the first born child of Cassana Estermont and Steffon Baratheon. He was a scant year older than his brother, Stannis.
What significant event in Robert's youth involved Lord Tywin Lannister?

According to Stannis, when Robert was five or six years old, the two brothers were brought to court by their father, Steffon, where they witnessed the Hand of the King, Lord Tywin Lannister, sitting on the Iron Throne and holding court.
What did Robert witness during his early life that involved his parents?
Robert and Stannis watched their parents' ship, Windproud, sink in a storm in Shipbreaker Bay while nearing Storm's End.
How did Robert's romantic relationship with Lyanna Stark develop?
Robert fell in love with Lyanna Stark, Eddard's younger sister. In time, Lyanna's father, Lord Rickard Stark of Winterfell, agreed to betroth her to Robert.
What was a notable action by Robert at the tourney at Harrenhal?
Robert held a drinking contest with Ser Richard Lonmouth, and swore to unmask the mystery knight known as the Knight of the Laughing Tree, although he failed to do so.
What event set the stage for Robert's Rebellion?
In 281 AC, Robert was present at the tourney at Harrenhal, where Prince Rhaegar Targaryen crowned Lyanna Stark, the queen of love and beauty, instead of his wife, Princess Elia Martell.
What triggered Robert's Rebellion?
The next year, Prince Rhaegar kidnapped Lyanna, which set in motion a chain of events leading to Robert's Rebellion.
What was a key battle fought by Robert during the rebellion?
Robert led the rebel forces during the Battle of the Trident, the decisive battle near war's end.
How did Robert respond to the deaths of Rhaegar's family after taking King's Landing?
Robert was pleased with the deaths of Princess Elia Martell and her two children, which led to a rift between him and Eddard Stark.
Who did Robert marry after becoming king?
Though Robert had no wish to marry after Lyanna Stark's death, he married Lady Cersei Lannister to ensure political stability and Tywin Lannister's support.
What was a significant marital issue between Robert and Cersei?
On their wedding night, a drunken Robert accidentally whispered, 'Lyanna' into Cersei's ear while consummating the marriage, setting a negative tone for their relationship.
Who was Jorah Mormont originally married to?
Jorah was married at a young age to a girl from House Glover as desired by his father Jeor Mormont, Lord of Bear Island.
What happened to Jorah's first wife?
She eventually died following her third miscarriage.
Why did Jeor Mormont join the Night's Watch?
Jeor gave up the lordship of House Mormont by joining the Night's Watch, which made Jorah the Lord of Bear Island in his own right.
What recognition did Jorah receive during Greyjoy's Rebellion?
He received a knighthood from King Robert I Baratheon in recognition of his bravery.
Who did Jorah meet and marry at the tourney at Lannisport?
During a tourney at Lannisport to celebrate the victory over the Greyjoy rebels, Jorah met Lynesse Hightower, and they were married at Lannisport.
Why did Jorah Mormont enter financial ruin?

Jorah attempted to reproduce the lifestyle to which his wife was accustomed but only succeeded in driving himself into financial ruin, by lavishing her with expensive gifts, hiring a cook from Oldtown, and a harper from Lannisport.
Why did Jorah Mormont flee to Lys with Lynesse?

Desperate to pay off his debts, Jorah took part in one of the Seven Kingdoms' oldest taboos, slavery. When House Mormont's liege lord, Eddard Stark, learned that Jorah had sold poachers to a Tyroshi slaver, he condemned him to death.
What happened when Jorah returned to Lys after fighting the Braavosi on the Rhoyne?
When Jorah returned to Lys, Tregar informed him that he would be enslaved for his debts, unless he gave up Lynesse and left Lys.
Where did Jorah and Lynesse flee to after leaving Lys?
While Jorah wanted to go to Braavos, Lynesse wanted a warmer home, so they fled to Lys instead.
What was the outcome of Daenerys's child Rhaego?
Daenerys's child, Rhaego, is a stillborn monstrosity.
What was Jorah's reaction to Daenerys entering Drogo's funeral pyre?
Jorah shouts at Daenerys when she walks into the burning pyre, which kills Mirri.
What did Daenerys promise Jorah after emerging from the ashes?
Daenerys promises him a dragon-forged Valyrian steel longsword and names him the first of her Queensguard.
What was the outcome of Jorah's spying for Varys?
Angrily, Daenerys sends them with Belwas and twenty men into the sewers of Meereen to take the city for her.
